title: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Search Tree
description: Given a binary search tree (BST), find the lowest common ancestor (LCA) node of two given nodes in the BST.
constraints: The number of nodes in the tree is in the range [2, 10^5].
p and q will exist in the BST.

brute-force.name: Recursive
brute-force.description: Use BST property to guide search.

steps.instruction: Define the function lowest_common_ancestor that takes root, p, and q.
If both p and q are smaller than root, search left.
steps.placeholderCode:
if p.val < root.val and q.val < root.val:
        return lowest_common_ancestor(root.left, p, q)
steps.hint: If both values are less than root, LCA is in left subtree.
steps.solutionCode:
if p.val < root.val and q.val < root.val:
        return lowest_common_ancestor(root.left, p, q)

steps.instruction: If both p and q are larger than root, search right.
steps.placeholderCode:
elif p.val > root.val and q.val > root.val:
        return lowest_common_ancestor(root.right, p, q)
steps.hint: If both values are greater than root, LCA is in right subtree.
steps.solutionCode:
elif p.val > root.val and q.val > root.val:
        return lowest_common_ancestor(root.right, p, q)

steps.instruction: Otherwise, root is the split point (LCA).
steps.hint:
If split occurs, current node is LCA.

Example:
Root=6. p=2, q=8.
2 < 6 and 8 > 6. Split! 6 is the LCA.

steps.instruction: Define the function lowest_common_ancestor that takes root, p, and q.
Loop while root is not None.
If both p and q are smaller than root, move left.
steps.placeholderCode:
if p.val < root.val and q.val < root.val:
            root = root.left
steps.hint: Move to left child if both values are smaller.
steps.solutionCode:
if p.val < root.val and q.val < root.val:
            root = root.left

steps.instruction: If both p and q are larger than root, move right.
steps.placeholderCode:
elif p.val > root.val and q.val > root.val:
            root = root.right
steps.hint: Move to right child if both values are larger.
steps.solutionCode:
elif p.val > root.val and q.val > root.val:
            root = root.right

steps.hint: Found the split point, return current node.
